title: 109_s3583
content: REGULATION OF PAYROLL TAX DEPOSIT AGENTS. An amendment to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 adds a new section regarding payroll tax deposit agents. The Secretary will establish a system for registration and renewal of payroll tax deposit agents, with fees not exceeding $100. Agents can choose to submit a bond or undergo an annual audit. Disclosures and direct notification requirements will also be mandated. The proposed regulations require payroll tax deposit agents to directly notify employers of nonpayment of employment taxes and impose penalties on unregistered agents. A payroll tax deposit agent is defined as a person providing payroll processing services with authority to access employer funds for tax deposits. The proposed regulations require payroll tax deposit agents to notify employers of nonpayment of employment taxes and impose penalties on unregistered agents. A payroll tax deposit agent is a person with authority to access employer funds for tax deposits, and must submit a bond of $50,000 to $500,000 as determined by the Secretary. The regulations require payroll tax deposit agents to submit bonds or security as prescribed by the Secretary. Annual audits for agents opting for it must be conducted by an independent third party, ensuring proper handling of escrow account funds and no misuse of funds for operating costs. The regulations mandate that payroll tax deposit agents must disclose to clients their liability for employment taxes and provide evidence of tax payments to the government. The Secretary also requires agents to disclose mechanisms for clients to verify tax deposits and other relevant information. The Secretary mandates that payroll tax deposit agents must provide clients with necessary information, including contact details for tax authorities, to assist in selecting agents. Only registered persons can make tax deposits, file tax returns, and access confidential tax information on behalf of employers. Regulations will be prescribed to enforce these provisions. Additionally, payroll tax deposit agents are subject to penalties for failure to collect and pay taxes. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include payroll tax deposit agents in the collection and payment of taxes. This amendment does not affect the interpretation of the code prior to the enactment of this Act. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections in chapter 77. The amendments regarding payroll tax deposit agents in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 will take effect upon the enactment of this Act. Penalties for failures will apply after the enactment date.
